Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant Spenser A. Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held April 17, 2017.
Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing

Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to Counts 1, 2, 3 in 16CF52, Counts 4, 5, 6, 7 w/be DRI as well 17CF03, 17CF17 along with the TR cases; agree forfeit cash seized of $900.25 and dismiss forfeiture action.  Joint recom. count 1 - 4yrs IC, 2 yrs ES; count 2 - 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES; count 3 - 1 1/2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES all concurrent, 3 days sentence credit.  Court received WOPH on felony counts, binds over.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties of counts 1, 2, 3, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to counts 1, 2, 3.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant and advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant admits charges for read-in purposes.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of counts 1, 2, 3 in 16CF52, DRI counts 4, 5, 6, 7; DRI, 16TR761, 16TR764, 16TR765, 16TR762, 16TR763; DRI 17CF17; DRI 17CF03; 16CV34 drug forfeiture action, drug money be forfeited to State Education Fund, not dismissing case.  State files Order w/Court.  State addresses court of appropriate joint recommendation.  Atty Randtke request furlough to attend friends funeral and State does not object; notes appropriate joint recom., no request for PSI.  Defendant addressed court.  In 16CF52, count 1sentenced to 6yrs WI State Prison, 4 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES; count 2 - 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES; count 3 - 1 1/2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES all concurrent to eachother, 3 days credit; count 2 pay costs believe $516 to be taken from bond and bond be returned out of respect for Grandmother; waive costs counts 2 & 3; conditions of ES:  provide a DNA sample; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; Eligible for ERP, CIP; sentence to commence 4/28 at 9:00 a.m., report to the Pepin County Jail.  Court holds up on returning bond money until he shows up.  Advised of appeal rights.
Letter from C.G.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 17, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges in 16CF52, 17CF03 and various citations.  Court notes received a warrant on new case in 17CF17 which he rejected for no case # and no geographical restriction.  Court notes Atty Randtke not showing on the new charge currently.  Court advises defendant of charge in 17CF17/max. penalties, felony prohibitions, and right to preliminary hearing w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  Counsel confirms close to a resolution on cases previously appeared on.  Court requests approval to reject warrant on new case and set matter for cont'd INIT.  State so agrees as long as it's set within 2 weeks.  Defendant waives time limits for PH.  Referred to JA for cont'd INIT in 17CF17 and STC on all other cases.
Status conference on April 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court thanks defendant for calling yesterday after missed his court appearance.  Counsel requests another STC.  Defendant confirms his address of what's on file. If proceed to trial, will file motions.
Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court.  Defendant f/t/a.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant authorized.

Status conference on March 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on March 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record, files WOPH form with the Court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA files Information with the Court.  Proceed into Arraignment.  Court advises defendant of charge as stated in the Information in 17CF03/max. penalties; advises defendant of charges as stated in Information in 16CF02/max. penalties; advised defendant of traffic citations in 16TR761, 764, 76t, 762, 763; advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters NGP all cases all counts.  Motion to Revoke Bond to track along.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Notice of Motion & Motion to Revoke Bond and Forfeit Bail
3 Citations filed associated to 3 charges in complaint (manually entered)
Preliminary hearing on January 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits waived for Preliminary Hrg.  Referred to scheduling clerk to schedule PH.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Spenser A. Weber in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Counsel inform defendant qualfies for Public Defendant.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties; count 1 alleges repeater; count 2 also has repeater rest do not; as to counts 1 & 2 repeater allegation have prior felony conviction, max. penalties could be increased not more than 4 years; advised of constitutional rights and right to preliminary hearing w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests cash bond, defendant has prior criminal convictions, felony conviction for fleeing as early as 2015 in Pierce County; ask $5000 cash, he failed to comply with law enforcement and he's a danger to the community.  Atty Smith informs Mr. Weber asks signature bond, cannot post cash; has ties to WI; he believes signature bond appropriate.  Address in complaint accurate?  Yes.  Own a home?  No he lives with his Grandmother who is in the courtroom.  Defendant is a farm laborer and works when called to work.  Not married, no children.  Court notes fleeing conviction from Pierce County; note facts of this case involving fleeing & resisting an officer & allegation of controlled substance discarded; substantial penalties for FTA; bond set $5000.  Waive time limits at this time for PH to get an Atty appt'd.  Court notes WTL for PH and set for cont'd INIT.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
